prompt: Satan faces the issues of being a single parent to the babies and children sacrificed to him
story:
**The Weight of Wings**

In the depths of the underworld, a cavernous throne room echoed with the whispers of the damned. Satan, the Morning Star, sat amidst the shadows, his piercing gaze surveying the sea of souls before him. But today, his attention was not on the petty squabbles of the fallen, nor the eternal torment of the wicked. Today, he faced a far more daunting challenge: the care of his children.

The babies and children of the damned, born from the darkness of human souls, now lay before him, their tiny hands grasping for his attention. Their eyes, like black holes, sucked in the light around them, leaving only an abyss of despair. Satan's heart, long thought to be a cold, calculating organ, now ached with a paternal love he never knew he possessed.

He remembered the first time he had seen a child born from the darkness. A tiny, wailing thing, no bigger than a thumb, with skin as black as coal and eyes that glowed like embers. He had laughed, thinking it a jest, a cruel trick played by the universe. But as he gazed into those eyes, he felt a pang of...not quite love, but something akin to it.

Over the years, more children had been born, each one a manifestation of humanity's darkest fears and desires. There was the little girl with skin like alabaster and hair like spun gold, who wept for the love she would never know. The boy with skin like dark leather and eyes that burned with an inner fire, who screamed for the freedom he would never taste. And the twins, small and identical, with skin like polished onyx and eyes that shone like stars, who whispered secrets to each other in a language only they could understand.

Satan's mind reeled as he tried to comprehend the weight of his responsibilities. He had never been a parent before, never known the joys and sorrows of raising a child. But now, he was faced with the daunting task of caring for these tiny, fragile beings, each one a unique and precious soul.

As he sat amidst the sea of children, he felt the weight of his wings, once a symbol of power and authority, now a burden. They pressed against his back, a constant reminder of the expectations placed upon him. He longed to fly, to soar through the skies, to leave this weight behind. But he knew he could not. Not now, not when these children needed him.

With a heavy heart, he reached out and took the hand of the little girl with alabaster skin. She looked up at him, her eyes welling with tears, and he felt a surge of love and compassion. He knew, in that moment, that he would do anything to protect her, to keep her safe from the darkness that lurked beyond the caverns of the underworld.

As the days passed, Satan found himself changing. He began to see the world through the eyes of his children, to understand the beauty and wonder of their tiny, fragile lives. He learned to laugh at their antics, to soothe their fears, and to guide them through the treacherous landscape of the underworld.

And though he still wore the mask of the Morning Star, the symbol of his power and authority, he knew that he was no longer the same being. He was a father, a guardian, a protector. And in that realization, he found a sense of peace, a sense of purpose, that he had never known before.

prompt: After Earth is destroyed , the surviving humans colonize two different planets . All contact between the two groups was lost , until they rediscover each other thousands of years later .
story: Tartok looked up . There was a falling star , an angel that had displeased Mother Sky . Tartok looked back at the water his narrow canoe was on , murky in the nighttime . He had better get back soon , or he could freeze to death . Water had splashed into his small raft and splattered him with currents of ice . He rowed back to shore , where his son Alrak , almost taller than his mother , who was much taller than Tartok , was waiting . He had the hounds tied up , ready to get loose and bring the man and his son back to their home . <newline> <newline> `` Alrak , '' Tartok said . `` Did you feed them ? '' <newline> <newline> `` No , '' Alrak said , short and sweet , the way his strict father demanded . <newline> <newline> `` Give them one fish to split between them . When we get home they will have one half buffalo steak each . These dogs worked hard today , bringing us all the way out here . '' <newline> <newline> `` Yes sir , '' Alrak said , quickly picking up a small fish and plopping it in front of the dogs . They bit into it ravenously , having not been fed all day . The rest of the fish would feed Tartok , his wife , his two sons , and his three daughters all week . While he and Alrak , the second-born of all seven children , were out hunting , his daughters were at home learning to cook , clean , and comfort by their mother , who was a master of all three . The youngest of the seven , Tartok 's second son was probably asleep . He would be taught to hunt tomorrow by his father and his brother . They had a plentiful fish harvest this week and would not need to come back . Sometimes these trips only sufficed enough food to feed them for half a week , or a day , or sometimes not even that . On the ice caps of Malwrak , the only parts inhabitable , anything could happen . <newline> <newline> As the dogs pulled the heavy sled connected to the canoe ahead and home , Tartok looked up . The falling star was back , but brighter than before . It left a red streak across the sky , and appeared to be headed to the center of the capital of Malwrak , which was much more advanced than here at the very edges of civilization . Tartok wondered what , if anything would happen if the star crashed . <newline> _________________ <newline> Talia mashed at buttons on the console . `` No , no , no ! '' she screamed . The ship could n't crash , not after how far they had come . They had sailed around the sun just to get here , the place people though might , might hold life . Talia , along with Jarak and Syphon had been sent on the ship after years of training . No one knew what the planet would be like ; large or small , hot or cold , high gravity or low gravity . They had trained for every possibility , and had gone through countless simulations of landing , which had to be done manually despite autopilot , but no one thought they could just run out of fuel ! Someone must have emptied some . <newline> <newline> `` Ship diagnostic ! '' she yelled . A sleek feminine voice calmly said , `` Oxygen : 100 % . Crew : 100 % . Weapons : 100 % . Shiel -- '' <newline> <newline> `` Just tell me what 's wrong ! '' Talia screamed . <newline> <newline> The ship paused for a moment before saying , `` Autopilot scrambled . Prepare for landing . '' <newline> <newline> `` No ! There 's nowhere to land ! '' she said , but the ship did not respond . <newline> A door opened behind her and Jarak walked in . <newline> <newline> `` Talia ! '' he said . `` Why are we landing ? There 's only cities beneath us -- '' <newline> <newline> `` *The autopilot is n't working ! * '' she yelled . `` Help me fly this thing ! '' <newline> <newline> Jarak ran forward and sat in the copilot seat . He had been the top of the landing class . He would know what to do . <newline> <newline> He looked out from the screen , showing what was outside the front of the ship despite the cockpit being in the very back . <newline> <newline> `` Um , there 's a field over there , '' he said . He started to steer the ship in the direction he had pointed , away from the towering buildings which seemed to be made of iridescent ice . The ship swerved , knocking into one of the buildings . A crater formed and some ice fell to the street below , but the sleek ship continued on its course . The place they were heading for was about 50 miles away , near the frigid sea that contained the borders of this country . The ship had detected the only life besides plants were at the pole . The city in the middle of the pole certainly proved that . <newline> <newline> They moved quickly towards the icy plain . There was a small cabin below , about two hundred meters from the sharp drop off of a cliff . Suddenly Jarak yelled . <newline> <newline> `` What ? '' Talia asked , panicked . <newline> <newline> `` Ca n't you see ? We 're overshooting the ice ! We 're going to land in the ocean ! '' <newline> <newline> Talia quickly tried to serve the ship , but at the angle they were travelling they had two possible destinations : the ocean , straight ahead , or the wall of a cliff made of ice if they turned . <newline> Talia and Jarak prepped for a water landing . <newline> ________________________ <newline> `` Did you see the falling star ? '' asked Tartok 's wife , Jæra when they had finished their dinner of fish steaks . <newline> <newline> `` Yes , as we were coming home , '' Tartok said bitterly . Alrak had given each dog a whole steak each , not half . They had wasted many steaks and would not be able to eat as plentiful this week , just the fish he had harvested . <newline> <newline> `` Were you hurt ? '' Jæra asked . <newline> <newline> `` No , we are fine . '' Tartok said . Jæra was always worrying . She worried too much , Tartok thought . <newline> <newline> Suddenly they heard a roaring above them , like a bird but sharper , stronger , somehow ... wrong . <newline> <newline> `` What was that ? '' Jæra asked . <newline> <newline> `` I do not know , '' Tartok said . He got up from his chair , one of two in the house , the other occupied by Jæra , and walked to the door . As he pushed it open , a sight unfolded that he could never have imagined . <newline> <newline> A metal bird with fire feet was flying towards the water . It would crash , but there was no other way for it to land without crashing into the cliff and possibly making the cliff fall into the water . Jæra had never wanted to be so close to the water , but Tartok had always said that they were far enough . She may have been right . <newline> <newline> The metal bird was large , large enough to hold Tartok 's entire family and the sleddogs . Suddenly part of its side flew off , and people jumped out . They had packs on their back , and as soon as they were in the air they pulled on a string and fell slowly , down and to the side . Only three jumped out , and the ship continued on its path to the ocean . <newline> <newline> When one of the people landed , Tartok walked up to them . `` What is going on here ? '' he asked . <newline> <newline> The person replied in a language very similar to Tartok 's . They were different , but Tartok could understand snippets . <newline> <newline> `` World ... ship ... first ... talk ... help . '' <newline> <newline> `` What do you need help with ? '' he asked , ready to do whatever he could to help people . He may be small and bittersweet , but Tartok was always ready to help . <newline> ________________________________________ <newline> The man in front of Syphon was speaking in a primal language . Talia hoped that Syphon would be able to understand him . She was sent as a translator , having studied all the languages of their original home , what was called something like `` Terr '' or `` Ert , '' that were remembered . <newline> <newline> `` We were sent to this world , '' she said , `` in that ship . You are the first people of another planet we have ever talked to . Will you help us make peace ? '' she asked in the language they used on their home planet of Lœa . <newline> <newline> The man said something in the primal language , and Syphon told Talia , `` He 's willing to help , but he only partially understands us . Do you have the ICD ? '' Syphon asked . ICD stood for *Interplanetary Communication Device* . <newline> Talia stared at her , wordless . `` I ... I thought you had it , '' she said . <newline> <newline> Syphon 's face went a stark pallor , matching the blue-white ice . `` Jarak ! You have the ICD , right ? '' she asked . <newline> <newline> `` No , '' he said . `` Why ? Do n't one of <newline> you ... Oh shit , you guys forgot it , did n't you ? '' Jarak was not one to cuss unless the situation was dire , which this certainly was . If they could n't find it , they would n't be able to tell the Lœans what they had found ! They 'd be stuck in this icy wilderness for their entire lives ! <newline> <newline> `` Oh , shit shit shit , '' Jarak said . `` Um , it was in the cockpit , right ? '' <newline> <newline> `` Yeah , '' Talia said . `` How did I forget it ? '' she muttered . <newline> <newline> `` Okay , we need to go find it . Ask him if he has rope , '' Jarak said to Syphon . <newline> <newline> Syphon translated the message since the man did n't speak their own language . He replied in the same language , and Syphon said , `` He says he can understand me now and that he does have rope . He 's willing to help us . '' <newline> <newline> `` Tell him to go get the rope , and that we do n't need his help . We can scale the cliff and get it ourselves . '' Jarak said bitterly . <newline> <newline> As Syphon translated , Talia said , `` Why should n't we have his help ? He probably knows the cliff and water better than us , and if we 're going to establish stable connections to this planet we may as well start now . '' <newline> <newline> The man asked something and Syphon replied . He said something again , and Syphon said , `` He says he knows how to scale the cliff and how deep the water is at places . He wants to help . '' <newline> <newline> Jarak sighed . `` Fine , but tell him to hurry . '' <newline> ________________________________________ <newline> Tartok hurried to the shed where the dogs lived , just large enough for all of them and the ropes . He slammed open the door and some of the dogs looked up , bored . He grabbed the rope he used to tie them to the sled . It would be enough to scale the cliff , about fifteen meters ; not very tall unless the bottom is a tide pool of liquid ice with spiky rock at the bottom , poking up randomly . He took it and some of the bones from the dogs ' dinners . He crushed them into a crack in the ice where they held . He stepped on it , and it held him . He slammed another right behind it , trying the same test . If it held him , it would certainly hold the young , bitter man who had escaped the bird . The man was tall but thin , probably weighing a little more than Tartok himself . He tied the rope around the bones and told the translating woman , `` I am ready to go with the man . '' When she tells her crew , she replies , `` The man is not going . The other woman is . '' <newline> <newline> Tartok is shocked . Surely the man is the captain of the crew ? <newline> <newline> It does not matter much . These people are from some far odd land and need help . They have different customs . Tartok is not one to judge . <newline> <newline> `` Okay , '' he says as the translator relays his message . `` Let 's get to work . ''

prompt: After Earth is destroyed , the surviving humans colonize two different planets . All contact between the two groups was lost , until they rediscover each other thousands of years later .
story:
**Echoes of Eternity**

In the depths of space, two worlds hung like lanterns, suspended in the void. Planet Aria, a terrestrial paradise, teemed with life, its forests a verdant tapestry, its oceans a sapphire expanse. Planet Kael, a scorched and barren husk, lay shrouded in an eternal twilight. The two worlds were the remnants of a civilization that had once spanned the globe, a civilization that had been reduced to nothing more than a memory.

The humans of Aria and Kael had been the last remnants of a dying world. They had fled the devastation of Earth, seeking refuge on the distant planets. But as the years passed, the connection between the two groups was lost. The silence was deafening, a chasm that seemed impossible to bridge.

On Aria, the humans had built a utopia, a city that shone like a beacon in the darkness. They had harnessed the power of the sun, and their technology had advanced to the point where they could manipulate the very fabric of reality. But as the centuries passed, the city began to change. The humans grew complacent, their connection to the world around them fading like a ghost.

On Kael, the humans had struggled to survive. The planet was unforgiving, its atmosphere toxic, its soil barren. But the humans had adapted, evolving into a hardy and resilient species. They had built a new society, one that was based on survival and perseverance.

And then, one day, the impossible happened. Aria and Kael were connected by a quantum entanglement, a thread that linked the two worlds in a way that transcended space and time. The humans of both planets felt it, a sudden jolt of energy that shook the very foundations of their existence.

As the connection grew stronger, the humans began to sense each other's presence. They heard whispers in the wind, echoes of a language that was both familiar and yet, utterly alien. They saw visions of a world that was not their own, a world that was both beautiful and terrifying.

And then, the first contact was made.

Aria's ambassador, a being named Lyra, stood at the edge of the city, her eyes fixed on the quantum portal that had opened between the two worlds. She felt a sense of wonder, of awe, as she gazed upon the humans of Kael. They were different, their bodies twisted and deformed, their eyes glowing with an otherworldly energy.

But as Lyra reached out to them, she felt a sense of recognition. She saw in their eyes, a spark of humanity that was both familiar and yet, utterly foreign. And in that moment, the two worlds were connected, their histories intertwined like the threads of a tapestry.

The humans of Aria and Kael began to communicate, their languages blending together in a beautiful, cacophonous symphony. They shared their knowledge, their secrets, and their dreams. And as they did, the world around them began to change.

The quantum entanglement grew stronger, a bond that linked the two worlds in a way that transcended space and time. And as the humans of Aria and Kael looked out into the void, they knew that they were no longer alone. They were part of something greater, a universe that was full of wonder, full of mystery, and full of endless possibility.

prompt: Every authority is baffled but for the past few years everyone has been receiving a Christmas present . To some delight and others horror , the gifts are based on how 'good ' you 've been .
story: Despite parents having said it for generations , * '' What did Santa get you ? `` * took on a whole new meaning on Christmas day , 2015 . <newline> <newline> On a day when the TVs around the country were usually playing Christmas songs from the 70 's , they were now fixed on the news channels , all with `` BREAKING NEWS '' banners flashing across the screen . Reports of robberies , with no sign of forced entry and cries over invasion of privacy , yet with no-one quite sure what it was of their privacy that was invaded . The only thing that was crystal clear was that during the night of Christmas eve , someone had entered each person 's home and placed presents under the tree . Not just randomly either . Each present was labeled and each mother , father and child in the home was accounted for . <newline> <newline> It took a while for some to notice , usually the families where the parents teased their children by delaying the gifts promising excitement and joy , but by midday everyone had discovered one extra present per person . Most children received expensive toys or video games and adults sometimes even found a new car parked outside ; keys in the ignition and a green tree hanging from the rear view mirror . <newline> <newline> Not everyone was happy though . Some had woken up on Christmas day to find something entirely different and unpleasant . Liars searched for their present only to find rotten fish , wrapped and pushed under floorboards . Men and women who had cheated on their spouses unwrapped their gifts to find naked action figures ; seemingly innocent enough but when picked up they would begin to reel off intimate details of their affairs while their partner was in the room . Needless to say , it was these very people who were shouting the loudest and writing to their local papers the quickest . <newline> <newline> The government was quick to step in , with the prime minister appearing outside his home in the late afternoon to speak to the nation . He spoke with countless microphones extended towards his face , but managed to keep his eyes on the camera placed dead center . <newline> <newline> * '' Good evening everyone . There does n't seem to be a single family across the nation who has n't been visited by 'Santa ' '' * he began , raising and bending two fingers to emphasize the fictional character . * '' I assure everyone that the government and I are doing our utmost to figure out what is going on , and to determine who is behind all of this . We ask for your patience as we begin our investigation . Please try to enjoy the rest of your Christmas ! `` * Without further comment , the PM waved as he retreated back into his home , where his staff awaited him . <newline> <newline> * '' God dammit , Linda . Find out what is going on ! `` * , the PM demanded as he threw off the reindeer knit his staff insisted he wear . <newline> <newline> Linda replied promptly , following the PM through to his office . * '' Of course , Sir . We have local law enforcement around the country inspecting people 's homes . I 'm not sure what we 're expecting to find though . Could it really be him ? * '' <newline> <newline> The head of the country stopped in his tracks , spun on his heels and stared straight into his assistant 's eyes for several moments without saying a word . Just as she was about to apologize , he stepped towards her , forcing her to step backwards towards the door . <newline> <newline> * '' Listen . I do n't care WHO did it . I do n't care WHY they did it . All I WANT is for the responsible party to be found and for their trespassin ' asses to be nailed to the wall . Am I clear ? `` * <newline> <newline> Linda , who was now half way out into the corridor , apologized profusely and span on her own heels and walked straight into the staff office . The PM adjusted the collar around his neck as he watched her scuttle away , then stormed back into his own office , locking the door behind him . <newline> <newline> He paced up and down the room , the heels of his shoes clicking off the hardwood flooring . He spent some time texting old friends in the police force , asking if they had any leads . When they did n't reply at a moment 's notice he threw his phone against the sofa at the back of the room . He eventually got tired of walking and returned to his desk where he had spent the whole morning before his staff demanded he speak to the press . <newline> <newline> Opening the drawer he pulled out a small box , wrapped in what seemed to be white wrapping paper with thin black lines . Upon closer inspection those lines were actually text from emails which the PM had written . Emails which should n't have seen the light of day . He held the box in his hands for several minutes , not reading what it had been wrapped in as he already knew it was all the information that would end his career . A career built upon bribes , deceit and some things much worse . With a heavy sigh he pushed his thumbs against the lid of the box and let it fall to the floor . <newline> <newline> The inside of the box was also lined with printed emails but in the center sat the hairband which he gave to his daughter the Christmas before he was elected . The daughter who was supposed to be on holiday , but who was now not answering her phone or emails . <newline> <newline> The PM sat at his desk with no holiday cheer around him , knowing that he had received , to put it lightly , the worst Christmas present in the country . Strangely it was n't the present or even his missing child that was haunting him the most . <newline> <newline> It was knowing that he had deserved it . <newline> <newline> -- -- -- - <newline> <newline> First writing prompt attempt ! Enjoy ! <newline> <newline> <newline> <newline> <newline> <newline>

prompt: Every authority is baffled but for the past few years everyone has been receiving a Christmas present . To some delight and others horror , the gifts are based on how 'good ' you 've been .
story:
**The Gift of Conscience**

It started with a whisper, a rumor that spread like wildfire through the streets. "They're coming for us," people whispered, their eyes darting nervously towards the sky. At first, no one believed it. But then, the first presents arrived.

A middle-aged man, known for his ruthless business tactics, unwrapped a small, intricately carved wooden box. Inside, a note read: "You've been a hard man to love. Try harder next year." The man's face contorted in a mixture of shock and shame as he realized the gift was a miniature replica of his own face, carved from a single piece of wood.

As the days passed, more presents arrived. A politician, notorious for his corruption, received a set of handcuffs and a note that read: "You've been a hard man to trust." A celebrity, known for her selfishness, unwrapped a small, ornate mirror, with a note that read: "You've been a hard person to love."

The gifts were always personalized, always tailored to the individual's past actions. Some were delightful, others were terrifying. But one thing was certain: everyone was receiving a present.

Governments scrambled to respond, but no one knew who was behind the gifts or how they were being delivered. Some speculated it was a prankster, while others believed it was a group of vigilantes. But as the presents continued to arrive, it became clear that this was no prank.

The gifts were a manifestation of the collective conscience, a reminder that our actions have consequences. They were a call to account, a reminder that we must strive to be better versions of ourselves.

As the years passed, the presents became more frequent, more personal. A CEO, known for his greed, received a small, exquisite music box, with a note that read: "You've been a hard man to love, but you've also been a hard man to forget." A politician, known for her hypocrisy, unwrapped a small, leather-bound book, with a note that read: "You've been a hard person to trust, but you've also been a hard person to forgive."

The gifts were a reminder that our actions have consequences, not just for ourselves, but for those around us. They were a call to accountability, a reminder that we must strive to be better versions of ourselves.

And yet, as the presents continued to arrive, some people began to feel a sense of unease. They began to wonder: what if the gifts were not just a manifestation of the collective conscience, but a warning? A warning that we are not as good as we think we are, that we are not as loved as we think we are.

As the years passed, the presents continued to arrive, a constant reminder of our own mortality, our own accountability. And as we unwrapped each new gift, we were forced to confront the truth: that we are not as good as we think we are, and that we must strive to be better versions of ourselves.

The gifts were a reminder that we are not alone, that we are part of a larger whole. And as we unwrapped each new present, we were forced to confront the truth: that we are not just individuals, but part of a collective conscience, a collective soul.

prompt: What 's on the tape ?
story: `` Is that it ? '' He sighed . `` Yeah . I hate watching these . '' `` It 's necessary . We have to know . '' Bob pushed the tape into the TV/VCR player that was all the department could afford . Up on the screen appeared a little boy , about three , clutching a teddy bear . `` Do n't . Please , not again ! '' The close ups were the worst . He reviewed it all . `` We have it . It 's all we need . '' Another day , another perp . One day , one day , we wo n't have to do this any more , thought Bob . If the medicine works , we 'll never have to do this again . He sighed , and for the last time , picked up the phone . `` Pick him up . He 's ours . '' The last man to be arrested for that hideous crime would be the first treated with the new cure .

prompt: What 's on the tape ?
story:
**The Tape**

It was a dusty, forgotten corner of the antique shop. A place where the past seemed to seep from the very walls, where the air was thick with the whispers of yesterday. Amidst the clutter, a single, unassuming reel of tape lay coiled on a shelf, almost invisible. The sign above it read "Vintage 8mm" in faded letters.

Lena, a curious collector of the obscure, had stumbled upon the shop while searching for a rare vinyl record. As she browsed the shelves, her fingers trailing over the spines of old books and the intricate carvings on a vintage typewriter, her gaze landed on the tape. Something about it drew her in – perhaps the way the light danced across its surface, or the faint scent of decay that clung to it.

Without thinking, Lena picked up the tape and examined it more closely. The label was worn, but she could make out the words "Private" and a date that looked like 1955. She turned the reel over, searching for a label or a note, but there was nothing. Just a small, almost imperceptible scratch on the side.

As she held the tape, a shiver ran down her spine. It was as if the tape was trying to tell her something, but in a language she couldn't quite decipher. Lena's mind began to wander, imagining the stories that this tape might hold. A secret love affair? A hidden message from a spy? A recording of a long-forgotten conversation?

Without thinking, Lena inserted the tape into an old 8mm player she had found in the shop's back room. The machine whirred to life, and a faint hum filled the air. The tape began to play, and Lena felt herself being pulled into a world that was both familiar and strange.

At first, the sound was a jumble of static and white noise. But then, a voice began to speak, low and husky. It was a woman's voice, and she was speaking in a language that Lena couldn't understand. The words were like a puzzle, and as she listened, the pieces began to fall into place.

The voice was speaking in a language that Lena had never heard before, but somehow, she felt like she was being initiated into a secret world. The words were like a key, unlocking a door in her mind that had been closed for years.

As the tape played on, Lena felt herself being transported to a different time and place. She saw a city that was both familiar and strange, a city that seemed to exist in a state of perpetual twilight. She saw people moving through the streets, their faces blurred and indistinct.

And then, the tape stopped. The machine fell silent, and Lena was left standing in the dusty shop, feeling like she had been changed forever. She looked down at the tape, still coiled on the shelf, and felt a sense of wonder and awe.

What was on the tape? Lena had no idea. But she knew that she would never look at the world in the same way again. The tape had shown her a secret world, a world that existed just beyond the edge of reality. And she knew that she would spend the rest of her life trying to uncover its secrets.

prompt: Write a story that is perfectly normal , until the last line .
story: `` Aw , do n't cry my sweet little girl ! You were so quiet earlier , even with all the racket my friends made ! '' <newline> Shrill screams and crocodile tears stream from her face , unrelenting . She 's heavy . <newline> `` Oh do you have a full poopie bag ? Is that why you 're crying ? I might just have to take care of this before I can finish cleaning the living room . Such a poopie monster , are n't you . '' <newline> `` Now , where did your mommy put those clean poo holders ? '' <newline> He rummages through the shelves . Empty bottles and bottle caps . He grabs the wet naps and baby powder then turns to the closet nearby . <newline> `` There they are . Do n't worry sweet thing , you 'll be clean and tidy before you know it . I 'm a cleaner by trade , and I 'm the best . '' <newline> He sets her on the changing table and begins his dirty work . Tossing out the old diaper . Grabbing a fresh wet one and tidying up the tiny butt cheeks , covered in muck . A dash of baby powder . Then the fresh diaper , brand new . <newline> The crying dies down . <newline> `` There you are sweetheart . Nice and clean . '' <newline> He picks her up and cradles her in his arms , gently . She 's almost asleep again . <newline> `` Hush little baby , do n't say a word ... '' he sings softly as he places her back in her crib and begins to rock her back to sleep . <newline> When the lullaby is over , he steps back to admire his work . <newline> `` No child should die screaming , `` he said as he reaches for the same gun he executed her parents with .

prompt: Write a story that is perfectly normal , until the last line .
story:
It was a typical Wednesday morning in the small town of Willow Creek. The sun was shining, the birds were singing, and the smell of freshly brewed coffee wafted through the air. The residents of Willow Creek went about their daily routines, some heading to work, others to school, and a few to the local market to pick up some groceries.

At the center of it all was Emily, a 30-year-old graphic designer who lived in a cozy little apartment above the town's favorite bakery. She woke up to the sound of her alarm blaring in her ear, and after a quick shower, she headed downstairs to grab a cup of coffee and catch up on the news.

As she sipped her coffee, Emily checked her phone for any important messages. She had a meeting with a potential new client at 10 am, and she wanted to make sure she was prepared. She spent the next hour reviewing her portfolio and making a few notes on her laptop.

At 9:45 am, Emily grabbed her bag and headed out the door. The streets were quiet, with only a few people walking to and from work. She walked to the town square, where the meeting was supposed to take place. As she arrived, she saw the client, a middle-aged man with a friendly smile, waiting for her.

The meeting went smoothly, and Emily left feeling confident that she had made a good impression. She spent the rest of the day working on her latest project, a logo design for a new restaurant that was opening in town.

As the sun began to set, Emily packed up her things and headed home. She spent the evening watching TV and reading a book, feeling content and relaxed after a productive day.

As she drifted off to sleep, Emily felt a sense of satisfaction and normalcy wash over her. She was exactly where she was meant to be, living in a small town surrounded by people she knew and loved. And as she fell asleep, she smiled to herself, feeling grateful for this ordinary, yet perfectly wonderful life.

But as she slipped into a deep sleep, her eyes twitched and her face contorted into a grotesque grimace, revealing a set of razor-sharp teeth and a tongue that was slowly turning into a snake.

prompt: Even with all the stars on the sky , the night will always remain dark .
story: The feast had been going on for days but there was no end in sight . It was not just the celebration of two people joining each other for a lifetime of happiness , it was four decades of constant warfare coming to an end . <newline> <newline> What started as a feud between to minor leudes escalated to the most terrible war the kingdoms had seen since the dawn of men . Fourty years of murder , rape and pillaging had devastated the land and the people alike , yet the table was richly set and the wine was flowing like the blood of those who had given their life for this peace . <newline> <newline> The marriage of Emperor Aldwyn II , Lordprotecter of the realm and Earl of the Lowlands to Winifred of Princess of the mountain peak , Lady of the narrow county was truly an event to be celebrated . Aldwyn had been sceptical of his bride . He was a young man and not a too bad looking one at that . His uncle had arranged this marriage before his death as part of a peace agreement between the two kingdoms . And he was happy about the peace , no doubt . But peace at the price of his life ? There were rumors about the Princess , her father was an old man after all and her mother one of the cave people . They were not exactly renowned for their beauty and gentle souls . <newline> His concerns were washed away when her father unveiled her before the altar . She was a stunning woman with eyes in a green Aldwyn had never seen before and hair in fiery red . When her lips curled to a timid smile Aldwyn fell in love . The next three days went by in a haze . He barely slept , but he did not mind . Drunk from the wine in his cup and the woman on his lap the young Emperor danced and feasted and dined like had had not since his own father fell at the sacking of Oldtown . He swore to himself he would one day be a better father , unlike the fool that raised him . And now he had the wife who would carry his beatiful offspring , future empires of not only the Lowlands , the Shire and the moors but also the Mountains Peak and the Narrow Land . He wondered what he would name them , as their names would go down in history for eternity . <newline> <newline> But as the third day went Aldwyns lust grew . Winifred had teased him since he carried her down the stairs of the cathedral and soon he would take what was rightfully his . He grabbed her arm and pulled her close to his face . Accidentally tainting her white dress with his wine colored saliva he whispered in her ear and the two went off to his quarters . He ripped her dress in two as the door closed behind him , pushing her onto the bed . He needed this and he would take it now . <newline> As he pinned her down a thought arose in his head . This was not some whore he had picked up in an alley , fearing for her life as she complied , this was his wife . <newline> <newline> He froze for a moment , searching for something romantic to say . `` You 're not as ugly as the rumors say '' , he spat out . She seemed unimpressed . He pulled himself off her and in a moment of poetic clearness he muttered : `` You are the stars on my sky , lighting the way home . '' Caressing her face he went for a kiss and was greeted by the point of a dagger penetrating his ribs . <newline> `` Even with all the stars on the sky , the night will always remain dark . `` , she whispered in his ear . She waited for the blood to dripple out of his mouth , then shoved the Emperors lifeless body off herself . The assassin covered herself with a cloak laying near the bed and held for a moment . She had all the time in the world , her husband was not expected for another hour and with the feast going on she would have no trouble escaping . <newline> What a fool she thought to herself as she climbed past the windowframe . He was right in one way though , Princess Winifred truly is as ugly as the rumors say .

prompt: Even with all the stars on the sky , the night will always remain dark .
story:
In the depths of a velvety blackness, a lone star twinkled like a firefly's lantern. It danced across the canvas of the universe, leaving a trail of stardust in its wake. Yet, amidst this celestial tapestry, a void persisted – a chasm of darkness that seemed to swallow all light.

Aria, a young astronomer, stood at the edge of this void, her eyes fixed on the star. She felt an inexplicable connection to it, as if the star's gentle pulse was a heartbeat in sync with her own. As she gazed deeper into the abyss, the darkness began to take shape – a living, breathing entity that wrapped itself around her like a shroud.

The star's light grew brighter, illuminating the void's contours. Aria saw a city within the darkness, its skyscrapers twisted and gnarled like a madman's sculpture. The city pulsed with a life of its own, its streets thrumming with an otherworldly energy.

A figure emerged from the shadows – a woman with skin as black as coal and hair that shone like the star itself. She reached out a hand, and Aria felt an electric jolt as their fingers touched.

"Come," the woman whispered, her voice a gentle breeze on a summer's day. "Let me show you the secrets of the night."

Aria followed the woman into the city, where the buildings seemed to shift and writhe like living things. They walked through streets lined with stars, each one a tiny, glowing eye watching their every move. The air was thick with the scent of ozone and smoke, and Aria felt her senses expanding, as if she was becoming one with the universe.

The woman led her to a great, crystal palace at the heart of the city. Inside, Aria saw a vast, dark pool that seemed to stretch on forever. The woman dipped her hand into the pool, and a ripple of light spread out, illuminating the depths.

Aria peered into the pool, and what she saw defied comprehension. The darkness was not just a absence of light – it was a presence, a force that pulsed with a power all its own. She saw the universe in all its glory, a vast, interconnected web of stars and galaxies.

The woman smiled, her eyes glinting with a knowing light. "The night will always remain dark," she said, her voice barely above a whisper. "But it is in the darkness that we find the true beauty of the universe – a beauty that is both infinite and infinitesimal, a beauty that can only be seen by those who dare to look."

As Aria gazed into the pool, she felt her understanding of the universe shift. She realized that the darkness was not something to be feared, but something to be celebrated – a reminder that even in the most profound light, there is always a shadow waiting to be explored.

The star above twinkled in approval, its light casting a warm glow over the city. Aria smiled, feeling a sense of belonging to this strange, wonderful world. And as she turned to leave, the woman's hand closed around hers, holding her back.

"Remember," the woman whispered, "the night will always remain dark. But it is in the darkness that we find the true magic of the universe."

prompt: You dress up as the `` classic '' reaper for a Halloween party -- black robe , toy scythe , all that jazz . Midway through the night , you hear a deep , dark voice in your head ... `` I need a sick day , man , and you look like the perfect person to take my place ... Your costume is almost perfect , after all . ''
story: Death waits for no man . That 's another way of saying the vacation package was absolute shit and the dental plan left a lot to be desired . Thankfully he was able to get his shift covered and take some well deserved time off during Halloween , he did n't even have to buy a costume . He knocked on Tom 's door with a big grin on his face , which was entirely coincidental but this time his skeletal visage *meant* it . Amanda let him in with a wave of her hand . <newline> <newline> `` Tom 's in the drawing room . May I get you two something to drink ? '' <newline> <newline> `` ... ... ... .. '' <newline> <newline> `` Oh . Uh , well I 'll just grab a coffee for Tom shall I ? '' <newline> <newline> Death passed silently into the drawing room , where an overweight business intelligence consultant was pouring over scrolls crossed out with red pen . <newline> <newline> `` Should n't have survived Woodstock . Has literally no immune system . Professional ninety-year-old basejumper *oh COME ON . * You 're here , good , take a seat . Seven failed suicide attempts despite trying her best ... <newline> <newline> Death hovered uncertainly at the door until Tom 's impatient waving brought him down to a wicker deckchair . Eventually the style pen was thrown against a litany of crossed names and corrections . Tom 's eyes met the hollow pools of darkness that seemed angled slightly downwards towards the floor . <newline> <newline> `` Cinco de mayo . Explain . '' <newline> <newline> `` ... ... .. '' <newline> <newline> `` Right well I 'll tell you what it is . It 's a bloody *disgrace* is what it is . Talking to the departed ? Welcoming home the ghosts of your ancestors ? As in , what are you even *for ? * '' <newline> <newline> Death stared without comment . <newline> <newline> `` In the past two hundred years everyone 's life expectancy has been booming out of control and you do n't even have the common decency to put a stop to it . I saw a lady who was a hundred and twenty ! A hundred and *twenty ! * I had to personally apologize for the delay and might I say she was *not* happy to see me . '' <newline> <newline> Tom shuffled the papers and dumped them onto Death 's lap . <newline> <newline> `` I 've prepared your itinerary for the following year . The whole world should have entered a global warming ice age three years ago and we have a *lot* of catching up to do if we 're going to make the antibiotics shortage before June . '' <newline> <newline> `` ... ... ... . '' <newline> <newline> Death grinned .

prompt: You dress up as the `` classic '' reaper for a Halloween party -- black robe , toy scythe , all that jazz . Midway through the night , you hear a deep , dark voice in your head ... `` I need a sick day , man , and you look like the perfect person to take my place ... Your costume is almost perfect , after all . ''
story:
The air was alive with the distant thrum of music and the chatter of revelers, a cacophony of sound that threatened to consume me whole. I stood frozen, a vision in black, my toy scythe at the ready. The classic reaper, a staple of Halloween parties everywhere. I had spent hours perfecting my costume, every detail meticulously considered. The tattered black robe, the worn leather boots, the scythe itself, a toy replica of the real thing. I was the epitome of mortality, a harbinger of doom.

As the night wore on, I found myself lost in the crowd, a sea of faces blurring together. I was a ghost, a specter, a mere mortal among the undead. And then, it started. A low, rumbling voice, like thunder on a summer's day. It was in my head, a presence that seemed to seep into my very marrow.

"I need a sick day, man," the voice said, its tone dripping with malice. "And you look like the perfect person to take my place."

I spun around, but there was no one there. The voice seemed to come from within, a manifestation of my own darkest thoughts. I tried to shake it off, to focus on the party, but the voice persisted.

"You look like the perfect person to take my place," it repeated, its words echoing in my mind like a mantra.

I felt a shiver run down my spine as I realized that the voice was not just a product of my imagination. It was real, a presence that seemed to be watching me, waiting for me to make a move.

I looked down at my costume, at the scythe in my hand. It seemed so... trivial now. A mere prop, a distraction from the true horror that was unfolding before me.

The voice laughed, a low, menacing sound that seemed to come from the very depths of my own soul. "You think you can just dress up as a reaper and pretend to be something you're not?" it said. "You think you can just play a role and expect to be taken seriously?"

I felt a surge of fear, a sense of panic that threatened to overwhelm me. I tried to speak, to tell the voice that I was just a partygoer, that I was not a real reaper. But my voice was caught in my throat, frozen by fear.

The voice laughed again, its words echoing in my mind like a curse. "You're not even a real reaper," it said. "You're just a pretender, a fake. And I'm the one who's going to make sure you pay for that."

As the voice faded away, I felt a sense of relief wash over me. I was safe, I was back in the real world. But as I looked down at my costume, I realized that something was off. The scythe seemed to be... twitching. And the robe, it seemed to be... moving.

I stumbled backwards, my heart racing with fear. I was not alone. The voice was real, and it was coming for me.

story: He was typing in a room . it had to be weeks since he heard the news of annihilation . From those that were still alive that is . Pretty average as a man scraping by in life could honestly be . An underachiever would be the hugest understatement His lisp , though held a subtlety , gave him a distinguished accent that made him sound more profound than he really was . This only added to his own charisma . Outside of parties , he stuck with friends , had some beers , and did a clockwork of '' eating , going to classes , having an obligatory 3PM cocktail right back in his dorm , , then a few of his dumb classes that he could actually pass . Afterwards , he 'd be crashing the town with his buds , getting hammered until finally passing out back in the dorm . Much of this was barely remembered , but rose-tinted eyes made the studying and maintaining a slightly average GPA worth it . <newline> <newline> The first week of the disappearance , he was in pure denial . Then he went back to his car , got the luggage case of his clothes and essentials , and rolls it right in there . <newline> <newline> Once he had washed up and gotten sanitized , he peruses through the kitchen . Until finally , he stumbles over the cookbook . He sat down with his laptop , opens up a YouTube video teaching him how to cook the food , and to his satisfaction , the food was phenomenal The food was the most he had eaten in a month , but to him , it felt like temporary paradise . He turns on the laptop and gets his few external drivers set up for his own media center , then binged watching a few movies , and Archer . <newline> <newline> Outside , the winds howled around all the skyscraper . The blizzard 's breeze grew harder and nastier than the night before . It gotten frostier , and the snowstorm slammed on right through . Effectively snowing himself into the high scale joint . The bodies , all aligned where they had taken their final steps , driving into poles , buildings or even plowing into people *and '' buildings , were completely neutralized . <newline> <newline> He decides to stay fore the night . Thoughts of those he had lost were no longer able to deny . It was one of those sorts of restaurants , like a dive bar meets fancy pub , that bordered for much of the middle class visitors their experience of the city . <newline> <newline> He could never afford it , but subsumed onto a diet of ramen , jerky and protein powder he had form home . <newline> <newline> <newline> Those few days back when he dedicated that as its own mausoleum , the Student pulled out the man 's wallet . The third week after the end of the world as he knew it . He never cared much about superstitions , gods , religion , or much of what he had termed `` crap '' . Seeing their disapproving gaze forces him to make it a day 's project to cover the window panels . He lined wood across them . While this considerably darkening the inside , as he was heavily conservative of the generator 's oil , power had became dependent on whatever he could pump on a weekly basis into cans . But the other advantage was the rugs the Student hung as tapestries . He supposed to himself that the remaining legs be used as firewood . <newline> <newline> <newline> <newline> He takes a look at the wife 's phone and browses through its contacts . Her name was Sandra . and she was a housewife . He deeply sighs , plugs the phone right back into the charging port . Another message dinged through the notifications . He rushed over to the other place and notices the man is gone , and now felt the brush of cold gunmetal pointing directly into the back of his neck . <newline> <newline> He realized he had made a fatal mistake . *Great , I 'm the jock . '' He did n't care to answer . She yells . `` HOW FAR UP -- '' <newline> <newline> <newline> Scott rolls his eyes and points right at the gigantic apartment complex. `` Shit . I 'm like up 39 windows . It smells like death . <newline> <newline> <newline> `` Why are all these bodies gathered here ? '' <newline> <newline> <newline> <newline> `` It 's not like I tossed them in here . It 's to make where I got stuck at into a decent home . Just put down your gun ... '' <newline> <newline> <newline> The woman noticed one of her mother 's fingers was lopped off . `` Her figner broke off . <newline> <newline> Scott takes away the gun , rips it out of her hands , before de-cocking it and setting its safety . `` It 's just a corpse . I 'm not sorry that reality makes it hard to believe , but the dead are just rotting corpses . We 'll never get back with them or do anything . <newline> <newline> While romantic that 'd you like to think there 's somewhere else . Everyone 's dead and there 's no cause . No damn reason . '' <newline> <newline> He points and aims the gun towards someone entering right through the door . It was a teenage boy , gawky . Thin as a rim and had a look of hipster art nerd , with his thick black rimmed glasses , curly auburn red hair and shaved sides . Both of them could tell he had never used a gun in his life as he was shaking and terrified . <newline> <newline> <newline> `` Drop it . He reaches into his pocket ... <newline> <newline> <newline> She takes the gun from his the Student 's hands and shoots the boy in the knee . he drops to the ground . <newline> <newline> <newline> `` Why the fuck did you do that ? '' <newline> <newline> <newline> `` This ... is my boomsticK ! ! ! Shop Smart ... . '' <newline> <newline> <newline> Scott finishes . `` Shop S-Mart ! ! So what 's your name , kid ? Or I 'll call you Annie . '' <newline> <newline> `` Jamal . Not a bad nickname . '' <newline> <newline> <newline> `` Remake 's okay .
